Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location close to the Seattle Centre and some great restaurants. Staff were a little standoffish, and there is no parking if you are staying for more than one night. We were lucky and were staying Saturday to Monday and Sunday parking is free on the streets, so we only had to pay a few dollars to park for Saturday night. The room was clean enough, bathrooms are very large. Only issue was the internet, very poor, and you had to PAY for it. If I'm paying $10 per day for internet, I expect it to be good. Starbucks downstairs, very good idea. Nothing like a hot chocolate after a day walking in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sugarbk
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Seattle and want to be in a great location. Major attractions are just a few blocks away such as the Space Needle and museums. I also loved that bus transportation was just outside the door and made it so convenient to go down to Pike's Market, Pioneer Square and shopping dowtown. The room was comfortable and had extras like a refrigerator and microwave. Starbucks in also connected to the hotel so goodies were available. The staff at the front desk was so nice and helpful. Thank you for a wonderful stay while in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for Lower Queen Anne / Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: TA_Scott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mediterranean Inn for 4 nights in early December. The hotel met all of my needs and was an excellent value. Location is excellent if you want to be in Lower Queen Anne, and just a short walk from Seattle Center (Space Needle, Experience Music Project, etc). Within 1-2 blocks there were excellent coffeeshops, a variety of food options, a great independent record store, a post office and bank/atm. Buses downtown are also easily accessible, and it's even walkable on a nice day. The room was nice enough - not overly large, but fine for me. Flat-screen TV, desk, fairly comfortable bed, large bathroom. Internet access cost $5/day or $15/week (i think) and wireless was weak, but they also provided an ethernet cord. Kitchenette had a mini-fridge, microwave and sink which was useful. Front desk staff was friendly and accommodating - they helped call cabs, stored our bags in a locked room before our late-night flight, etc. Overall no complaints - nothing over the top, but got the job done and was a pleasant stay. If you're looking to stay in Lower Queen Anne I can't imagine a better option that the Mediterranean Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with terrific security”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl59
Reviews.Content: Well located for travel with either a car, or for public transport. The undercover parking is extremely safe because of the security gate (swipecard operated), and there are security cameras monitering the hallways. We also felt perfectly safe walking in the area, even at night. The hotel has an inner courtyard. The rooms overlooking this wee courtyard are extremely quiet. The outer ones on the road sides are also fairly quiet because of the double-glazing, and also have good views. The only problem we encountered was that our swipe cards didn't work on the parking garage door, but it's probably been fixed by now. Apart from that, it's a fantastic hotel and we look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: JanaT09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mediterranean Inn for couple of nights and loved it. The room was comfortable with nice furniture and quiet. There are quite a few restaurants, market, bus stops, stores that are close by, and a Starbucks (attached to the Inn)....All very convenient making our stay more enjoyable. The staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs. This is our second time staying here (last trip was Fall 2009) and we'll definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel for a leisure traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Mplstraveler11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, and is clean, and modern. Plenty of restaurant options within walking distance, and cabs are readily available to take you anywhere you want to go. Walking distance to the Space Needle and Mono Rail. The front desk clerks were all very friendly, outgoing, and helpful. We went to the capital hill area quite a bit and it was about an $8 - $10 cab ride each way. I also love having a refrigerator in my room when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: mlonetto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, the area is great. Nice restaurants, a grocerie store around the corner, a movie theater next to the hotel. Close to Seattle center and a 30 minutes walk to downtown. Buses very close. Calm hotel and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Location”
Reviews.Author: dcannon2403
Reviews.Content: Recently, we traveled to Seattle for a long weekend and Seahawk Football Game. We chose to stay at the Mediterranean Inn located in the heart of Queen Ann, walking distance to the Space Needle and Monorail. This hotel presented the best value. This hotel has been updated on the inside. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It offers a gym and great internet service. This area has many nice restaurants in walking distance. For getting around Seattle, we just walked to the Monorail. The public transit system in Seattle gets you anywhere you want to go whether it be the Monorail, buses, light rail or a combination. There is no need for a car in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central hotel close to the Space Needle and mono rail link to shopping centre.”
Reviews.Author: TTbiker
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean and receptionists pleasant and helpful. Only fault was that it had microwave with kitchen cupboards etc. but no plates or cups.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, service, location, value.”
Reviews.Author: lroden
Reviews.Content: This is a great, well-equipped place for a business or leisure visit, with a remarkable rate (about $70) found through web travel sites. The Queene Anne location is super convenient to activities in all key areas: downtown (Pike Place and financial district just a few minutes drive), Seattle Center and cool local neighborhood restaurant scene (walking distance), Lake Union airport for seaplane tours (less than 10 minutes), just across bridge from Bellevue (easy freeway access avoiding downtown traffic.) Much better price and nicer atmosphere than a downtown hotel without sacrificing anything. The hotel was clean, fresh, spacious, well maintained in every regard. The staff was welcoming and eager to help at all times. Particularly notable touches: - room has half size refrigerator, microwave, coffee machine, and grocery store is right across the street, as well as a dozen restaurants within 2 blocks - flat screen TV also has DVD/CD player - good bedding, lots of pillow choices - parking is secure wtih mesh garage door ($15/day), easy elevator access to rooms; - using internet in room is just $5/day - can use either WiFi or they will lend you an ethernet cord - 2 free terminals in lobby and FREE printing of boarding passes etc. - roomy FREE use of office center with another 3 terminals, free printing - Starbucks is adjacent to lobby and that has free WiFi too - free 24 hour exercise facility - room had all other amenities: iron/board, toiletries, hairdryer, etc. This was a great find, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Rosetealady
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, spacious room overlooking the small, neat, relaxing courtyard. Staff was friendly, courteous, helpful with restaurant ideas and stored my luggage til I left. Inn is close to the Metropolitan Market which is open 7/24 for food, Seattle Center, and bus stops. Roof deck has great views of downtown, Queen Anne hill and harbor. You can print your boarding pass in the business center. There's no need to bring your laptop to this inn, they are fully equipped with internet and printers.Fitness room has weights and treadmill and more with water and APPLES.Complimentary water and coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful roof deck, great price for location”
Reviews.Author: florafloraflora
Reviews.Content: The Mediterranean is in busy Queen Anne, separated from downtown Seattle by just one neighborhood (Belltown). I stayed there twice in one week, going away for a couple of nights elsewhere in between. This is a lively neighborhood but not noisy at night. Nothing disturbed my sleep. I was attending an event at Seattle Center but I also found that Queen Anne was a convenient place for my friends to meet me, whether they were driving or taking transit. Both nights my room was small but comfortably furnished. The hotel has all the amenities I ask, namely a fridge, wifi and a fitness room. There is no breakfast served in the hotel but there are lots of places to eat within a one-block radius (Uptown Espresso for coffee and pastries, the Mecca Cafe for the bar scene and ribsticking diner food, and Roti Indian Restaurant, among others) and there's a Metropolitan Market (high-end grocery) open 24 hours just a block to the west and a block to the north. If you have free time in the evening you could do worse than catch an art film at the Uptown just a couple of doors up the street. The roof deck with its fantastic view of the Seattle skyline, Queen Anne Hill and Elliott Bay is a huge plus. I ate my breakfast there in the morning and took friends there at night. Having checked in and out twice in a short time span I dealt plenty with the front desk staff and did not have any trouble with the rudeness described by other reviewers. Staff were not obsequious, maybe slightly brusque at first, but courteous-to-friendly by my standards. Certainly don't let fears of rudeness stop you from enjoying this wonderful deal in a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “true disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gray5bryant
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the mediterranean inn during July which is suppose to be cool in Seattle. Well it wasn't and this hotel was very, very poorly equipped to handle it. We had 4 to a room and there was no air conditioning. We couldn't even get a fan because they didn't have enough to go for each room. There are 2 elevators and 1 was broken the whole time we were there. When my parents arrived the day before we got there both elevators were broken and they had to stay in the lobby until they were fixed. Hours later, they got to their room. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. It was located very close to the space needle. there was one positive out of all of the trip. Their customer service was terrible also. Would not stay here again. Would try another hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Mikefaw
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel very convenient to the sights and in a great neighborhood with a lot of interesting restaurants just a block or two away. Had a comfortable room with a handy fridge and big flat screen TV. A not so nice view of the building next door from our room but the view from the rooftop patio was superb. You would think a rooftop patio would be easy to find but there is no signage directing you to the correct stairwell. You might want to call the hotel directly to find the best rate. They beat any rate I found on the web and even better then their own website. Only problem I had was with one of the front desk guys. At check in when I told him we were checking in and gave him my last name his response was, "credit card and picture ID". That's it. Not a welcome to our Inn, not a thank you Mr ____ for chosing us, just a quick "credit card and picture ID". Do these people know how many choices we have in hotels? Front desk personal need a refesher in customer service. In spite of that guy i would still stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Muncher55
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly. Rooms were clean. We had a room facing the street and the sounds of the city didn't bother us at all. Bus stops are close by and take you directly downtown. Its a 15 minute walk to the waterfront. Lots of places to eat within walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: kcwildcat35
Reviews.Content: For $99 bucks a night you can't expect a whole lot, but this hotel is pretty nice for the money. It is right by a bus stop that will take you into downtown/pike place market...but the downside is that it is right outside of the bus FREE RIDE ZONE so you will have to pay to ride. It is a short walk to the Space Needle, and there are a handful of good restaurants just north of the hotel. Our room was tiny and did not have any A/C, so we had to leave the window open and people talking outside woke up my wife. And if you want wifi, you either pay $5 a day or go down to the lobby and use the Starbucks free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sjanee
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 days stay at the Mediterranean Inn. The desk employees were friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable. There's a little kitchen with coffeemaker, microwave and fridge. Also present a smoothing iron and ironing board. There were complimentary coffee pads, popcorn and bottles of water. There's no restaurant in the hotel but there's an in house Starbucks. We had breakfast in nice restaurant nearby: Toulouse Petit Kitchen and Lounge: great food and coffee. Just opposite the road is a big Safeway supermarket. Nearby Seattle Center with Space Needle, monorail etc. Don't forget to go to the rooftop: great views and you can smoke there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we thought we were getting”
Reviews.Author: hoocur
Reviews.Content: This was not the best choice on our trip through the northwest. The hotel had some pros but unfortunately, too many cons. Pros: close to downtown, easy access to the space needle and Alaskan Way, roof top deck, comfortable beds Cons: my reservation had been cancelled but they had one room left - not sure who cancelled it. The room was tiny - 2 double beds - both against the wall with small walk way in between. No air conditioning, so opened windows - looked right into an apartment in next building and their unit system hummed LOUDLY and blew warm air into our room. They provided a fan but had to take it apart and clean the blades before using. The grey blades became navy blue! Tough to sleep as it was very warm in our room - 22 celcius the day we were there. charged extra for parking and for internet so our "great deal" wasn't so great.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, CRAP WEBSITE”
Reviews.Author: SanStormin
Reviews.Content: The website makes this hotel seem like a two-star hotel, but it is nice. We had a Queen room on second floor w/o air conditioning in July. We though it would be hot, but the room was fine. Closed Windows kept out the traffic noise. No car is no problem. Staff is busy and helpful. Rooftop view is a real plus. Print boarding passes and ck email in the business center. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, not far from the monorail, and Pike PL market is a bit far, yet walkable. We went on Savor SEATTLE food tour and enjoyed it. I took off one star for the busy street in front.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to stay here on your trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: skygirl340
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and offers terrific value for money. It is in a lovely location and is a safe neighbourhood. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay in the city. I loved the room. It was clean, spacious and comfortable. Our room overlooked the inner courtyard which didn't bother us at all for 2 reasons. 1.) There is no noise when you are trying to sleep. 2.) The view from the rooftop terrace is magnificant so that's where you go for the great view, not looking out your window! There is a starbucks attached to the hotel which was great. We enjoyed buying our breakfast there and then taking it up to the rooftop to eat it there and relax and enjoy the view. Be sure to walk up the hill to get to Kerry Park on Queen Anne Hill - stunning views there too. In the reception area there is a couple of computers with internet access which are free to use for guests. There is no in room safe however there are safety deposit boxes to use at reception. Some great places to eat round about the hotel. Easy to get downtown with buses right outside the hotel, or walk to the space needle to get on the monorail or even just walk the whole way. Next time I'm in Seattle this is where I'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the top”
Reviews.Author: JBSquared1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay in Seattle for a couple of days after our cruise to Alaska. Since we only had a couple of days, we wanted something close to the popular attractions in Seattle, i.e. Space Needle. This place turned out to be an excellent value. It's not too expensive and you can walk to the Space Needle. It was also easy to jump on the monorail and go downtown, Pike's Market, and the aquarium. The room was comfortable and clean. There's no air conditioning but since the high temperature was about 70 degrees, it didn't matter plus you can open the windows. We loved that there was a Starbucks attached to the lobby. The best thing was the rooftop deck where you can just sit in the chairs and enjoy a spectacular view of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value - very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lucsdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend and for the price [ratings] I have nothing but positive things to say. Staff was on top of things from the moment I spoke with them prior to our reservation, and the entire time I was there. Got the room/beds I requested and like their $200-fine policy for smoking in the non-smoking room. You really do get a non-smoking/smoked-in room that smells fresh. We got the 4th floor corner room looking out over the street. Any fears I had about road noise were unfounded - Friday and Saturday nights with all of the bar/Dick's traffic was barely audible. The hotel is solid - it was packed with tourists and I didn't hear anyone next door or in the hallways etc from my room. Bathrooms and amenities are basic - what I expected for the fair price. Parking is under the building and worth the $15/day for peace-of-mind [yes, in-n-out privileges]. To print out airline checkin and maps I used the lobby and business center computers. Location is great. Very short walk to Key Arena. Wide range of food/bar options within 2 block walk. Dick's across the street can't be beat for burgers & fries. 2 blocks away is a huge grocery store as well. Starbucks in the lobby/attached but I preferred the classic Seattle coffee shop 1/2 block up the street [great coffee and scones]. Mecca Cafe 1/2 block up street is a great boozers bar at night and a breakfast place in the morning...city's smoking ban means the place doesn't reek. [bar is walled-off from the restaurant]

Reviews.Title: “The roof makes it!”
Reviews.Author: nkps5113
Reviews.Content: My husband was on business, I pleasure. We both enjoyed our stay. Friendly and very helpful desk staff, quiet and efficient maid staff. Loved the fresh cool air flowing through open windows and comfortable mattresses, we slept like babies. (we heard from other guests, "road side" is noisy) The Monorail, a short walk through the park, brought us directly to the shopping district. But above all the roof makes it. The views day and night were fabulous, The entire Seattle Skline including Mount Rainer, in addition to the Olympic and Cascade Mts. Tip: several good restaraunts in the nieghborhood (Toulouse Petit and Peso's) along with The Metropolitan gourmet grocery store. Enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Rooms, avoid ones next to Queen Ave”
Reviews.Author: NoCoretiree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way back home, as it was near our son. The rooms were amazingly good and clean, I liked the ambience of the hotel and the location would be superb for exploring the city center on foot, which we were not doing on this trip. I had no issue with $15/day for the parking and the views from the deck were photo-worthy. OMG on the views from the rooftop deck at sunset. I only have two significant negatives about this place. First, the kids at the front desk have absolutely no customer service skills or respect for customers, particularly those not their own age. They are dismissive and unhelpful. Second, we stayed on a very hot night- the rooms have no A/C, meaning you leave the windows open. The noise and lights from Queen Anne Ave kept us from sleeping (It is noisy and there is no way around it), so make sure if you are sensitive to that you don't get a room with the windows opening to Queen Anne Ave. Would I stay there again, yes, with reservations - they just need to fire the kids at the front desk and don't get a room facing Queen Anne Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: delightful47
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Seattle enroute to British Columbia and spent one night at this perfectly located hotel. What a bargain. The rooms were neat, clean, comfortable and stocked with microwave and coffeemaker, which unfortunately did not work. There were dozens of neighborhood restaurant choices within walking distance. The rooftop deck has a beautiful view of Seattle and Puget Sound. Don't miss it. The windows open and as ours faced the street, we did have some street noise from cars and the passing cable car. I don't think they had air conditioning, but we certainly did not need it. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable option near Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: christineBoston
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff and a fine small hotel in Seattle. The rooms are most comfortable, with fridge and microwave...unless you require air conditioning. There are some rooms with AC, but they cost more. I personally loved having open-able windows, and in July, Seattle was wonderfully cool at night for sleeping. Plus, it's got a GREAT roof deck with such views of the harbor and the Space Needle skyline! And they have four computers set up for guests, with printers, so you can get your boarding pass, check email and make reservations or check opening hours for Seattle places. Parking is available underground for $15/day too and given Seattle parking meters, it's a good deal. Kudos to the hotel. I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected but a pretty groovy place”
Reviews.Author: West-Field-Trash
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty neat place. Our room was more like a studio apartment with a little kitchen. It was just down the street from a Safeway Super Market which was handy when my son got sick during the night. This hotel warned me beforehand that they were trying to be green (welcome to Seattle) but the place didn't have air conditioning for one thing. June in Seattle can be hot and sticky....It was OK though, the windows open and we were on the 3rd floor. The street was very quiet below and we got a good nights sleep. The beds were older and the place certainly isn't the Ritz, but neat in it's own way. The bathroom was sort of older but clean and like I said, it was more like a studio apartment rather than a regular hotel room. The area this hotel is in, is very quaint. The people I talked to (the locals?) seemed very nice. The staff was very accomodating and eager to give me information. They even told us how to use the local mass transit buses to save money and time. I liked this hotel, although I would imagine lots of people looking for a spa like atmosphere would not be so impressed. If I had to say one thing negative it would be the elevators are slow slow slow and because of the no air conditioning thing, they are hot and stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLolabunny
Reviews.Content: We had a rocky start when they didn' t have a room for 3 availible and they where all booked up. We came to a solution of one of the rooms has a baywindow with a couch in it and they would make that up as a bed. After that the stay was wonderful. The Med is perfectly located. We walked to the Seattle Center which was only a few minutes walking distance. We purchased the city passes at the music experience and found all but one place was within walking distance of the Inn. The lobby has 2 computers that you can use for free to find out schedules and locations of everything listed in the book. There is also a business center if you need to print something. The same floor as the lobby is the washers and dryers. It cost 75 cents to wash and 75 cents to dry. The next time we go to Seattle we will book a room at the Mediterranean.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH better than 2 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: TomL_Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: I don't get the rating of this hotel. OK, it's probably not a 4 star, but 3 or even 3 1/2 seems about right. Would recomend to anyone. Great location, everything in good condition, and a really nice business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value !! Centrally Located, Clean, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Krista1212
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room with Kitchenette, DVD player, Flat screen TV, and $ 5.00 fee for internet ( not wireless ). Parking is $ 15.00 per day. Great Gym, friendly staff and lots of great restaurants everywhere. Located in the Queen Anne district. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon7777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in May this year. Basically, loved it! The hotel is out of the CBD a bit in a nice suburb, with great variety of good value restaurants. It is about a casual 10min walk to the Space Needle (about 5min to Key Arena). To get into the CBD could you always catch the monorail (for $2) and save the 30min walk. The hotel room was generous, well decorated and clean. It had a real comfy bed, but the bathroom had a noisy exhaust fan which I found kind of annoying even with the door closed. The room had a kitchenette (complimentary water, popcorn and coffee). It had a fridge and microwave etc (which was great as there is no restaurant or breakfast) but there is an awesome supermarket nearby (3min walk with everything prepared at excellent prices). There is Starbucks downstairs. Free internet access at 2 computers in the foyer. The staff should also get a rap.. they were great - friendly, helpful and courteous - cant thank them enough. Also, don't forget to go to the roof.. nice views of the city. Overall, would definitely recommend and would most certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, not so good value for money”
Reviews.Author: beargo
Reviews.Content: We were planning to spend 4 days in Seattle and pre-booked this hotel hrough Expedia. We booked a room with a kitchenette and when we arrived we disordered the following things: - We received a room with a window to the inner yard. When we asked to switch, we were told that reservations made with Expedia are not treated the same and we can't switch to a room with a window to the front. When we spoke to Expedia, we were told that they are not aware of such treatment and it's not a part of their agreement with the hotel. I can't tell who is to blame here, but the bottom line is: if you choose to stay in this hotel - make the reservation directly. - Kitchenette: The kitchenette included a sink, a mini fridge and a microwave. It did not include any kitchenware such as glasses, plates, knifes and forks and didn't include any kind of stove. How will you eat your microwaved dinner? - with some plastic plates you'll buy yourself I guess... - The internet was not free (this is common in large cities) and costs and additional $5 a day. There is not wifi internet and you have to use a cable. Overall, we don't think that the $130 rate provides good value.

Reviews.Title: “This is a cute hotel with dvd players...”
Reviews.Author: zombielova
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel with dvd players & little kitchenettes in the room. It's a close walk to the space needle & you can easily catch the monorail or bus downtown, but if you want to walk it's about 1-2 miles to the market. The staff was very helpful & polite, Barbara was awesome. There are lots of cool places by to eat, try the mecca for a good breakfast. The were renovating on our floor but it was still clean & nice. The rooftop deck offers a great view.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Walla99362
Reviews.Content: I've used the Mediterranean Inn many times for both business and leisure visits to Seattle. It's location on Queen Anne Hill makes it both convenient and out-of-the-way: it's within walking distance of downtown (or a quick bus ride) but quieter and more relaxed than a downtown hotel. The rooms are cozy, comfortable, and quiet with a refrigerator, coffee-maker, and microwave in each. There are plenty of eating options nearby including a Starbucks in the lobby and a grocery store across the street. The only warning to give is an extremely tight parking garage if you're driving a car: anything larger than a compact will be difficult to maneuver in the small confines of the underground space.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value in fun neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MadisonGrog
Reviews.Content: Hotels are expensive in Seattle, so the price and relative location of this hotel make it attractive. The rooms are pretty spartan. The 1st floor Starbucks is a plus, even in Seattle where great coffee is everywhere. There is a great grocery and several fun eateries nearby. And don't forget to go up to the roof for some nice views come sunset. We had a room right on Queen Anne Ave, so it sometimes was noisy at night. And it is a little bit of a walk to the bus stop. The bottom line is that I plan to stay there again next time I visit that section of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Budget Travelors”
Reviews.Author: TradingPlaces4fun
Reviews.Content: Best kept secret in Seattle! What a pleasant surprise, I was looking for something on a budget that had a great location near to city center, with a secure parking garage, a business center, gym and located in a safe area. Bingo! It's no frills, but very comfortable and charming with a European flare. The rooms were well equipped with kitchenettes, coffee maker, fridge with complementary bottled water, microwave w/ popcorn. House keeping did a great job. Staff was helpful, the business center was the best I've seen-complementary (several HP computers with internet access, printers, fax, copiers- no waiting.There's a great roof top deck with a panorama view of Elliott Bay and down town Seattle- one of the only hotels in Seattle to have one. Great location! The Mediterranean Inn is just a short 5-10 minute walk to Seattle Center (Space Needle, monorail, museums etc.) It's in a cute part of town with an abundance of cafe's, bistros and shopping nearby, plus there's a Starbucks adjacent to the hotel lobby. I booked with Travelocity for $70. per night, which was quite a bit less than booking with the hotel directly. Great value! I'll be back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: AirchairExplorer
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Mediterranean Inn at the conclusion of an Alaskan cruise. The hotel provided fair value for the cost. Close to Seattle Center and the Monorail to downtown. Actually, downtown is a nice walk for most people. The hotel had free access to the internet and two computer terminals with printers available. Nothing fancy here, but affordable and good (safe) location. Less than $7 taxi ride from cruise ship to hotel. We jumped on the monorail, walked around the downtown, and walked back to the hotel. Enjoyed a night at the Jazz Alley (walking distance) and a train ride the next morning to Vancouver ($9 taxi ride to the train terminal).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in an underrated city”
Reviews.Author: storey917
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed it a great deal. The location is absolutely superb - 2 mins walk from Seattle Center, and the bus that goes downtown stops just outside the hotel and takes about 10 mins. The room was quiet and clean and excellent value. The staff were courteous but not particularly friendly compared to typical American customer service. (Check-in is stated as 4pm but I arrived at 10 am and was told if I returned at noon my room would be available. I returned at 1 to be told it was not ready and that "check-in is at 4". This was frustrating as I could have stayed out and returned at 4 if I hadn't been told to return at noon. The next day, I heard another guest having exactly the same frustrating conversation.) However, this is the only minor criticism I have of an excellent stay. Make sure you visit the roof terrace as the views are stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here turned out to be a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: tntonthego01
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Seattle for the weekend for a campus tour of University of Washington. We were visiting the Emerald city for the first time so sightseeing was also on our itinerary. I almost booked a room at a hotel by the U-District, but found the Mediterranean Inn; a mere 6 miles away from the school, and close to the cityâ€™s sights, the latter was a favorable choice. And with rates less than $100/night, it was also a practical one. Located in the unassuming neighborhood of Queen Anne, the hotel is a 5- minute walk to the Needle; a 10-minute cab ride to Pike Place Market; and a 15 to 20 minute ride to the University. Though small, little touches like: wallpaper in the bathroom, a basket to hold toiletries, and a curtain in place of a closet door, created a homey feel to the room. The carpetâ€™s a bit run-down but the bed is comfortable enough to give you a good nightâ€™s sleep. However, if you're a light sleeper, the occasional street noise could be a bit of a bother. The room also comes with a fridge, a microwave, and a coffee maker- great amenities for those traveling with small children. Wi-fi isnâ€™t available in the room but there are 2 computers in the lobby that you can use. The Starbucks below is also an AT&T hotspot. One reviewer mentioned that the staff seemed aloof. I did notice that, but donâ€™t be put off; they can be quite accommodating when you ask for help. They can also arrange for transportation to the airport for a flat rate of $43. Probably the same amount for a cab ride, but a good option if you want a nicer car. Restaurants in the area that are worth trying: Phuket Thai restaurant, Skycity in the Space Needle, and although we didnâ€™t get a chance to try it, I heard that Dickâ€™s across the street serves up good burgers. For some quiet time with a view: check out the rooftop. Thereâ€™s a row of deck chairs that you can use to take a load off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: beebow123
Reviews.Content: Lots of local "flavor" within walking distance. Hotel far exceeded my expectations and I will definitely stay there again as well as recommend it to anyone I know travelling to the Seattle area!

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: OutofAK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mediterranean to be near the Seattle Center and the location was perfect, just a couple blocks walk. We were disappointed to learn that there was no breakfast offered (for some reason we thought there would be) and it would have been nice to be given a little more feedback from the staff about were to eat dinner. It seems like the ones we spoke with didn't have very much knowledge of the local options. We ate dinner at a pizzeria within walking distance and since we were only a block from Safeway and could purchase food since our room had a refrigerator! The room was a comfortable and clean and since we were one of the upper floors we had a great view of Puget Sound & Downtown. The rooftop view were even better! It was still pretty chilly in April so we couldn't enjoy the chairs up there, but it was still a great place to get photos of the city. Also a note that the parking situation is a bit tight. We drive a small vehicle so it worked out okay, but just beware that you enter the basement parking garage from the alley and it is has very small spaces, with a low ceiling. Overall we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, HIGHLY recommended!”
Reviews.Author: emuhlee44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect spot for leisure travelers. It's located in Queen Anne, with easy access to Safeway, the space needle, diverse local dining, and bus stops. Even 24-hour fitness is just a block away! The room was clean and relatively quiet. Service was great for the most part. However, some hotel attendants seemed aloof. Also, there is no wi-fi in room, although you can pay $5 a day for internet connection (DSL). It is best to get hotel parking ($15/day). You will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a Key Arena Event!”
Reviews.Author: cbabeej
Reviews.Content: Girlfriends and I were attending a concert at the Key Arena at the Seattle Center and decided to make a night of it and stay here...what a great choice! The hotel is only 2 blocks from the Key Arena and an easy walk, so no worries about trying to catch a taxi or bus back downtown along with everyone else - what a treat! Lots of options for restaurants and bars in the area...we checked out Solo for apps & drinks before, yummy and hip. The service at the hotel was quick, friendly & efficient and they have private, secured parking for an additional $15...room was fab, we had a double queen corner room with french doors looking over Queen Anne Ave which provided lots of light and traffic wasn't as noisy as one might anticipate...overall a perfect accomodation for our situation. If you were staying in Seattle more with downtown in mind, you might want to stay downtown...but the Monorail is quick and easy and just a few blocks away, and a 5 minute run to downtown! As we were leaving we realized we didn't check out the rooftop terrace...must do on our next visit! Oh, and there's a Starbucks connected to the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Trip from Hell!!!!”
Reviews.Author: couger198124
Reviews.Content: This hotel use to great, keywords USED TO BE. This rooms were dirty and someone was smokeing weed on my floor and i let the frontdesk know and all they had to say was that they were aware of it. Then housekeeping woke me up early even tho i had a DND sign. Overalll my trip was ruined and when i asked to ask with the GM he keep telling the front desk to let it go to voicemail. Please spend your money else where b/c the service is horried there.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: leap444
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from Key Arena for under $100 a night? Yes please. We were able to walk to EMT, Key Arena, the fair and the monorail in less than 10 minutes. Dick's burgers is right across the street, and there are some cool bars and restaurants scattered around the area. You can take the monorail to the mall downtown to shop for $2. We took a cab home one night from close to the Public Market and it cost us less than $10. Basically... win! Also, we were not expecting the rooftop deck! 360 degree view of Seattle with lots of deck chairs - would be awesome in the summer. There is also a weight room, although I didn't see anyone using it. Rooms were basic, but clean and stocked. Bottled water was replaced each morning. Would have liked a microwave, but I'm not gonna complain too much. Plus, there's a Starbucks attached to the lobby. How can you lose? Would definitely stay here again. Great value - and the location!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Paul507
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel here on Tripadvisor, and I'm glad I did. The location is fantastic and the rooms are clean, the staff are helpful. If I had to design a neighborhood to locate a hotel in, I'd design one like the Med. is in. For instance, the Space Needle is a short, enjoyable walk . There are restaurants right near the hotel like Dick's, a couple mexican restaurants, an Irish pub, and Thai food. There are two supermarkets- one of which, the Metropolitan, is worth a visit even if you don't need anything. There is also a record store that is right out of the movie "Empire Records". I'd stay there again and will- next time I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Week End / Valentine's Getaway”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyIdaho
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for pleasure to just get out of town. It was a last minute decision and we lucked out and were able to still get a room at the Mediterranean Inn which was the hotel our friends were staying at. We were please with Hotel. Wasn't quite what we were expecting from the pictures but it was still nice. We got a good rate on it. We wouldn't have stayed if we'd have had to pay the full rate of $129 or $139. The rooms were average sized but we didn't feel like we were walking all over each other. They were clean. The mattress was one of the most comfortable mattress we have ever slept on when staying in a hotel/motel and we have had to stay in a lot with pleasure and business. We didn't access the fitness area and we didn't see a swimming pool. At a later date of visit we would like a pool. We thoroughly enjoyed the access to Starbuck's right off the lobby. Starbuck's is one of our favorite places and it has sentimental value so the convenience was awesome. However, all in all our stay was very pleasant. The front desk was awesome. Excellent customer service. We would definitely recommend to others and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again”
Reviews.Author: JodeeF
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with this hotel, within walking distance of lots of things, employees friendly AND helped us when we had car trouble. Thankyou Conan. Room very comfortable. Had to pay for parking but hey it is Seattle. Great view from top deck!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel right near the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: MrsC333
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and had a great experience. The staff were very helpfull and nice, the room was large, bathroom clean (a little out dated but fine) and the location was pretty good too. It is a short walk to the Space Needle and from there you can catch the Monorail for $2 each into town. The best thing about this hotel was the complementry Internet access from the lobby. We could email or family and friends and tell them what a great time we were having.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in a beautiful city...”
Reviews.Author: timmi9
Reviews.Content: When I selected this hotel, I chose it based on reviews. The hotel was great for people wanting a great location at a great price. It is located about 500m from Seattle Center and the walk there can be beautiful. Also within longer walking distance to Pike Place Market and the foreshore. For people without a car, this is the place to stay. The rooms were adequate, the only problem we had was that the shower was made for people with a disability, which meant that the water leaked on the bathroom floor easily and made it very slippery at times. The fitness centre was good, and there is a cinema and supermarket next door. I also like the very simplistic, yet homely, feel to the place. The staff were great and there is a Starbucks right out the front for people who love their coffee. I definitely made a great choice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “will be visiting this hotel again, for sure!”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the hotel later in the evening, as we were on our way home from California, but this hotel definately seems like somewhere I would come back to. It was decorated nicely, very clean, and friendly. Our room was a decent size, had a kitchenette and a big bathroom, which is a must with children. The neighbourhood seemed good and close to all the Seattle attractions. Safeway is right across the street and there were a couple restaraunts and a movie theater I noticed down the street. Next time I visit Seattle, I will be coming back to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Easy Access to Monorail - Downtown and Pike Place”
Reviews.Author: travelforfunandbiz
Reviews.Content: First time staying in this hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised! This is how hotels should be! Good value for money. It was such a good price we were afraid to book it - but we were very happy and will be back again! Keep up the good work Mediterranean Inn. I would recommend this place but I don't want to give away the secret! Also, it's a bit out of downtown, thought it would be closer to walk. It wasn't a bad walk but taking the Monorail right at Key Arena was easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for a hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: koniption
Reviews.Content: Positives: location (Starbucks outside the front door, Seattle Center across the street, great bars nearby, Dicks burgers across the street), inexpensive, decent rooms, rooftop viewpoint, Starbucks in room coffee, ... Negatives: water pressure in the shower, daily parking fee, internet fee

Reviews.Title: “Historic, local hotel”
Reviews.Author: likeslocalstuff
Reviews.Content: Clean, functioning, quiet. Got it for under 100.00. Internet 5.00, should be free but. Parking 15.00 in/out privileges. Careful trying to get in and out though as you can scrape the bottom of your car. THE ROOFTOP! Incredible view of the Sound!!!! Great location!!!! Lots of restaurants right up the street as well as grocery stores. Went to Pesos for breakfast!! WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff *be cautious the rooms”
Reviews.Author: curtisTexas
Reviews.Content: The rooms have b een remodeled but cheaply done, the pictures are misleading. The roof top terrace is nice and has a wonderfull view. The staff is friendly. Overall the Hotel is a Motel 6 with a few extras. I would have ratther done more research. By the way i asked to speak with the manager...she did acknowledge me but never came to speak with me (very dissapointed in Her ((manager))

Reviews.Title: “For the price, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: WAMarathoner
Reviews.Content: The Mediterranean is an older hotel, two short blocks from the Key Arena side of the Seattle Center in Queen Anne. It has been lovingly remodeled in warm yellows and browns, and shows obvious care. Unfortunately, it still retains a couple of the negatives from its former life. Rooms are smaller than most (except the corner queen suites, which are large and beautiful), and there can be a residual smoke odor. The hotel is completely non-smoking, but smells as if it didn't use to be. It's not a quiet place, and you may be able to hear the baby crying in the next room (we did). The positives include very comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and excellent staff. They are top-notch, especially Guadalupe, who seemed to bend over backwards for every guest. Amanda was nice, but a "loud talker". I didn't see more than two people on duty at a time. They were busy, but appeared to be in control. There is underground parking for $15/day. A very large and well-equipped business center, plus two computers in the lobby for quick use. Starbucks is accessible through the lobby. A decent fitness room is on the bottom floor, along with a laundromat and snack room. The front door is secured at night, accessible only by key. The Med rents rooms by the night, week, or month. A furnished studio for a month is $1065, less than most rents in the area. Safeway is half a block away; Dick's burgers across the street. We booked through Hotels.com, and were surprised to find that we could've gotten the room more cheaply through their Web specials on their site. Make sure to check. Unless we got a great deal at the Westin, we'd likely stay here the next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located budget getaway in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: salsadama
Reviews.Content: We made last minute reservations on Thanksgiving night. We didn't know what to expect but wanted to be in the city the next AM for the parade and shopping. What a pleasant surprise to find this spot! Our room was comfortable and clean. We felt safe and at home. Usually, I tend to stay in pricier luxury hotels that when discounted cost $150 to $200, not including parking. After taxes and parking this was under $100! This night away was just for a place to sleep so we could enjoy the next day in the city. It was perfect. There were some small cosmetic issues with the room, but nothing that compromised safety or comfort. Our only complaint was that our window didn't close properly. We weren't on a ground floor, so it didn't matter much to us. At least the thermostat worked, and the electric heat was a welcome change to hotels that blast noisy air on you off and on all night. Everyone was helpful, efficient, and friendly. The next day we walked downstairs to grab coffe, then to the Seattle Center to take the monorail to downtown. It was a bonus that parking at the hotel was only $15, so we were able to leave the car there. We chose to park on the street at night (free), right in front of the hotel. We only parked in the garage for the daytime which was only $7.50!! For the room alone I paid about $80 using an online discount site . Considerating that was the price AFTER taxes and fees, and after we "upgraded" to a queen bed, we were thrilled with the price. Another bonus was the microwave, sink, and refrigerator which was a perfect mini-kitchen for us to store food after our Thanksgiving feast. We filled it up, even though it was spacious. (we snacked on our complimentary popcorn and water during the day, too.) We will definitely stay again for a quick city getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: BigJimH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here November 6 & 7, 2009 for a mini-family reunion and booked three rooms. Arrived late Friday night in a downpour and got utterly lost in downtown Seattle. (note to self: always always always take a GPS to Seattle..the roads in downtown are confusing in the best of times, but insanity in rush-hour traffic, after dark in the rain.) Samantha at the front desk, bless her heart, guided me, over the cell phone, turn by turn right to the front door. Then she had all our keys and parking slips ready when we walked in. This set the tone for the WHOLE weekend...the staff at M-I are amazing people!!! We had two different room types (two rooms w/ two queens & one room w/single queen). Aside from the sq footage, the rooms were all equally well appointed. Modern amenities, clean, comfortable and quiet. The rooms each included microwaves, coffee pots and a sink and counter, as well as nice comfortable easy chairs. The larger rooms each had large screen LCD tvs, the smaller room had an older crt version. Internet access is only $5/night. Located on Queen Ann avenue at the corner of Republican, it is centrally located to much of Seattle highlights. In walking distance are a huge variety of restaurants and cafes, including the legendary Dick's Drive-In which is directly across the street. This hotel is only one block from Key Arena and Seattle Center. The Space Needle is on the opposite side of the center from the hotel, so it's equivalent to about a 4 or 5 block walk. My only knock is there is no in room safe, but this is inconsequential considering the value. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Great Area!”
Reviews.Author: Airstreamlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this inn last week with my husband. It is in a nice area that has many small restaurants in tree-lined area, and is stone's throw away from downtown. Hotel is clean and has courteous staff. Fully stocked workout room with bottle water. Room has microwave and fridge (perfect for storing my Pike Place cheese purchase!). Parking was $15, with in-and-out privileges. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, but we had lattes and scrambled eggs at the Metropolitan Market, two blocks away, which is almost identical to Whole Foods supermarket. You can buy a hot breakfast there in the morning, or choose things from a large salad bar and hot meal section in the evening for dinner. Going downtown is very easy, no need to drive, as the Monorail is a ten minute walk from the Inn. The Monorail ride is less than a minute from there to downtown -- so easy! Will stay again at this hotel in March when we attend a concert and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Better than city centre.”
Reviews.Author: scubaben
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived early and we took a bus from the airport to the hotel. Approx. 40 minutes. The Hotel had our resurvation and stored our bags until the room was ready at 3:00p.m. We walked uphill to the north several blocks turned left and came upon a beutiful lookout over the ciry and the bay. It was a warm and sunny autumn day and we spent over and hour enjoying the view and walking through into the upland housing area. It was the perfect way to start our 5 days in Seattle. The Hotel staff were extra helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were clean. I would definitely stay there again but not in the summer as there is no air conditioning. Great restaurants within the surrounding 2 block. For lunch the metropolitan grocery strore has some great soup and sand. The transit system in Seattle works really well. We found Seattle to be one of the friendliest places we have ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: jdalbert
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in Seattle that wouldn't break the bank but was centrally located (and not a hole in the wall). I happened to stumble upon a very competitive rate for this hotel through my credit card travel provider. Overall, I'd say the hotel was fairly nice. The rooms have a mini-kitchen in them (microwave, bar-fridge, coffee maker) and they provide you with free Starbucks packages (to make in the provided coffee maker) and microwavable popcorn. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was quite nice as well. The hotel's location is also quite good. There are quite a few restaurants nearby (including a Thai place that was incredible - and apparently ranked as one of the top-100 in the United States). It is a short walk to the Seattle Center, where you'll find the Space Needle, science center, Sci-fi / music museum, and the monorail to the city-center. Overall, very convenient location, which allowed us to leave our car in the parkade and simply walk (or monorail) to most destinations. There is also a Safeway right across the street which is nice for picking up breakfast/lunch food. The only downsides were: 1) Pricey parking - this appears to be typical of most inner-city Seattle hotels, but still can't say I was thrilled with the somewhat expensive daily parking rate 2) Not all rooms have A/C - I paid extra money to "upgrade" to a room with an air conditioner (which was somewhat noisy, but kept the room cool). While I would recommend getting a room with A/C in the summer, it's not great that you have to pay extra for it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, but staff wasn't accomadating”
Reviews.Author: whoisbonyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove up from Seattle after I had been quoted a price over the phone ($10 difference). Upon checkout neither front desk staff nor the management would lower the price. The staff got a little hot with us when we persisted. Both my wife and I heard the price quoted and since we didn't receive a confirmation email, which they swore was sent, we had nothing to back our story up. Later we looked at our friends receipt, who also stayed at the same place and had a different price for the same room. Guess what the difference was....$10. The accommodations were average, but the bad experience with both the staff and management made the experience a poor one. I'm sure there are other places to stay in town. Wouldn't you want to stay at a place that treated their customers better?

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Place”
Reviews.Author: rockladygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice if you don't need to be super close to everything but want to be close enough. You can get anywhere with the Seattle bus system it seems, and there is a bus stop 2 blocks away. It is a quiet room and I slept very well. The room is average size. I got a great deal on this hotel, but it was the off season. I would recommend this hotel to someone who wants a clean, modern, solid hotel but doesn't have to be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: brizzyguy
Reviews.Content: For the low price I paid for this hotel, it was exceptional value. Nice clean room, clean bed and reasonably good mattress and pillow. No views from window, it faced an internal courtyard, but that's OK, no problem for me. No free internet, but they do have PCs and an office area downstairs that guests can use for free. There is also a Gym and Laundry, soda/snacks Vending machines. There is a Starbucks downstairs as well. Go up to the Roof, you will see fantastic views of Seattle city and Puget sound. Staff/service was good. Location is good, just a short walk to the Space Needle. I had dinner at the restaurant up there,and the views and food were fantastic. You can ride the monorail from the Space Needle to Pine St, Downtown for a few $. From there, all local buses are free. My room had a mini fridge, microwave and sink, but I did not use it. The TV worked fine, limited number of channels, but that did not concern me. Bathroom was roomy, and clean. All in good working order. The room was generally quiet and I slept well. I had no rental car, but they did have basement parking. After check-out, I took a town car back to SEA-TAC for $38. You can go a lot cheaper by light rail if you have time and energy. Ask the front desk to book the town car for you, I think they get a special rate. To summarize, a very well run hotel that will suit most people at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ANIK&D
Reviews.Content: There were four coples on this trip and we were cruising to Alaska on 9/6 so we decided to stay in Seattle for the two days prior to our cruise. When we arrived early on 9/4 our rooms were not ready but since it wa approximately 11:30AM that was not a problem. We were told that our luggage could be stored while we either went out to eat or while we took advantage of the roof-top terrace. We did both. The view from the terrace wassimply beautiful and we were able to take some really wonderful pictires of the Sound, Space Needle, etc. At 3PM our rooms still were not ready and after having flown across the country at 6AM (EST) we we failing fast. The Front Desk Staff was very apologetic. When we were finally able to get into our rooms we found that they were clean and nice but not glamorous in any way but that was fine because we knew it was a small hotel. What we did not know,however, was that only 20% of the facility was air conditioned. Since I am asthmatic air conditioning is generally a must for me. To my dismay I could not get a room with air because the hotel was fully booked due to the LSU/Washington State Univ game and the Jazz Concert, etc. but I was switched to a room with better ventilation and in a location that was not over the street so I would not be subjected to auto fumes. The remainder of our stay was great! The staff gave us directions, made suggestions and even arranged for tranportation when needed. We had unlimited free computer use and exercise facility use. The hotel was located within walking distance of the Space Needle, monorail andmany other attractions. It was on the bus line and near enough to Pike's Market for those who like to walk. Our group agreed that we could not have made a better choice of places to stay and whenever we return to Seattle we will stay at The Mediterranean Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time! Am now friends with the staff. Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ObservantEscapades
Reviews.Content: Located in the fairly quiet neighbourhood, Queen Anne, this hotel became my proper home from home in the first week of my first ever visit to the states. After bansihing the hideously ugly bed spreads to the closet as soon as I arrived, I settled in, but never had I expected to get so comfy in this place! Clean, good shower, dated decor & vcr system (though tapes are availble to watch & my English dvds wouldn't work there anyway). Having a kitchenette in the room is a HUGE help as a gluten/dairy/meat free traveller, and having a Safeway across the road means food is always readily available and reasonable. There is also a cinema across the road, & the hotel is situated one block from key arena which hosts music events and basketball... There are 2 computers for quick use in the lobby, (you have to stand to use them) but there is also a 'Business Center' (not exclusive for business customers use) where you can sit for longer periods. A small exercise room stores the stacks of leaflets on things to see & do-if you want ideas (I discovered these on my last day!) but you shouldn't need them as Seattle is such a great city & there is plenty going on if you just walk into town & look around. The centre of town *is* a bus ride away, (fares $1.75 tickets valid for 2 hours) but you can always use the monorail for two bucks more (return) & this gives you reason to walk into the wonderful Seattle Centre each day, host of the Experience Music Project, The Fountain Dome, & of course the Space Needle-(aswell as many other delights!) I was particularly keen on checking out live music while I was in town, and the reception staff were sooo helpful, looking things up for me while I ran errands or was out sight seeing, we have kept in touch! I would definately stay here again, it's just the right amount of home you need, and an excellent, safe base to explore this wonderful city. One more thing-Fabulous view on the roof top terrace. See the sea at sunset & the city skyline by sun rise. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option if you don't want an overpriced downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: egland95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterranean Inn following an Alaskan cruise and loved it. We could not find a reasonably priced option downtown, even using Priceline, so we started looking beyond the downtown area. This hotel was located between the Princess cruise docks (which are a few miles North of downtown) and the downtown and a couple blocks from the Space Needle. We dropped our bags off early in the morning and walked to Pike's Market Place. The walk wasn't too long or strenuous, so we didn't bother with the public transportation options. The hotel staff was very courteous and friendly. The Metropolitan Market is a couple blocks away, and it was great for stocking up on Seattle chocolate and Seattle coffee for souvenirs. We also picked up some bread, smoked salmon and fresh Washington peaches for a picnic on the hotel's rooftop deck. We enjoyed the views of the city, Mount Rainer, and the setting sun. The rooftop deck cannot be beat! Our room was clean and comfortable. The Starbucks coffee for the in-room coffee maker was quick and convenient and the car service the hotel arranged to the airport was reasonable and very convenient. Do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel that needs a/c”
Reviews.Author: gjlav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the August heat wave in Seattle with record-breaking temps. The hotel rooms have no a/c, except a few that you can upgrade to for a fee if they're available, which they weren't. They have ceiling fans, which help, and large windows, so it was bearable, but just. The rooms are nicely decorated, clean, and comfortable. The staff was fairly helpful and friendly. The hotel is located a couple of miles from Pike Place and the waterfront, which made for nice walks, but it's a bit of a trek if you're not into that. The Starbuck's on the premises is a plus. A few good restaurants in the immediate vicinity, as well as a grocery store 1/2 a block away. Free internet in the lobby. Not a bad place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple and Cute”
Reviews.Author: samebrightsky
Reviews.Content: The Mediterranean Inn was cute, quaint and small. The rooms were smaller than your average hotels but considering that it was an Inn made it more quaint. It is in the Queen Anne neighborhood and wasn't VERY close to downtown but close enough. You could walk there if you please, it's about a good 1.2 miles. PROS: Good neighborhood, lots of good eats - Dick's is very close by. They have very good ice creams! There is a Safeway around the corner so you can get all your essentials you need. There are also something like CVS and another supermarket. There are a row of restaurants near the hotel, namely a place called 5 Spot up the road. It is a HELL of a walk, so you may need to take the bus bc it is uphill. They serve breakfast and is very nice :) Seattle Space Needle is walking distance. CONS: Not very close to Downtown, you would have to take public transportation. BUT, they are very close to the bus stop and almost every bus goes downtown so thats a plus. Bus fare is $1.75 and you get like 4 hrs or so to transfer and things. Its VERY convenient! =D Most buses downtown are FREE as well so go crazy haha Hotel also has a small kitchenette. Microwave, sink, cups, popcorn, starbucks coffee, and water bottles :) No AC in the hotel. However, being that it's Seattle, you don't really need the AC on most of the time. The weather is very cool, and if you leave your windows open, you will feel the coldness in the air.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice staff, cozy enough!”
Reviews.Author: geppe1970
Reviews.Content: we stayed here two times. First time we got a nothing special room, but the second time we got a very nice room on the 5th floor with a great view of the space needle and downtown.. the location is excellent - close to the space needle. There's a nice terrace on the top where you can enjoy sun and a beautiful view of downtown. There's also a small gym near the reception. No breakfast but enough space in the room to have a quick continental. Price was ok, service great. we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for tourists who want to save money”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in room 424 for one night on September 26, 2009. Overall we enjoyed our stay and were pleased with the accommodations for the price we paid. My wife and I were only in town for about 30 hours to see a Seattle Seahawks football game and meet up with friends. We were primarily only looking for a place to rest at night. This hotel was ideal for such a stay. The Mediterranean is a little out of downtown, but you can take a bus for $1.75 and be in downtown in about 5 minutes. You can also walk to the Space Needle. The area seemed very safe with lots of restaurants. We arrived around 1:30 pm and the official check-in time is 4:00 pm. They were able to get us a room immediately, which was very gratifying after flying 3,000 miles across the country. The room was a little on the small side and it showed a little age. The carpets in the hallways definitely need to be replaced. The bathroom was of a decent size, clean, and had nice water pressure. There were plenty of towels. The amenities were of a good quality. The bed was a full-sized bed, but was big enough for the both of us and comfortable. The channel selection was only OK. Most other hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in had a larger selection. The room also came with a refrigerator, microwave, mini-kitchen, desk, and sofa chair. There was a complimentary continental breakfast in the morning, which we did take advantage of, and they also had a fitness center. I especially liked that the hotel provided us with two free bottles of water and microwave popcorn in the room. The staff of the hotel was very friendly too. After I went to retrieve my luggage from the concierge after the football game was over, I offered â€œGuadalupeâ€� a tip, but she refused. That was nice customer service. The hotel also had a nice rooftop deck with plenty of chairs to relax in with an awesome view of the Seattle skyline. They also had two free internet stations and a Starbucks connected to the property. As for the negatives: Like other reviewers I agree that the window coverings were bizarre, giving you an option of total darkness or light with total transparency for others to see in the room. The dÃ©cor was appropriate during the era of the Carter Presidency, not today. The rooms were on the small side and there could have been more channels to choose from. However, this was a good deal if youâ€™re primarily in Seattle for sightseeing or other business and want to save money. I would stay here again. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: twojays1708
Reviews.Content: Mediterranean Inn is a great choice when staying in Seattle. The location is fantastic and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooftop patio is terrific. Rooms were clean. Will definitely stay there next time in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worst...”
Reviews.Author: c1d
Reviews.Content: Some things about this hotel were great, other things were not... Location: If you are planning on only spending a few days in Seattle location is perfect, right next to the Space Needle, Experience Music Project etc. However, it is a bit of a walk away from Pike Place Markets and the city centre (~20mins). If you're spending more time in Seattle might be worth trying to stay a little more central. Rooms: The rooms themselves were simple, a little dated but other than that were fine. What I did not like was most appliances had something wrong with them. Several buttons on the remote control would not work (power and channel buttons), alarm clock was broken, light globe for the desk lamp had blown and the toilet would not flush. The toilet was rectified immediately but the others we had to chase up to get fixed. Amenities: 5/5 for this one. Had a fitness centre, business centre (free to access) and a laundromat all within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, spectacular views, couldn't have been happier"”
Reviews.Author: brickpilot
Reviews.Content: My only regret about my two night stay at the Med was that I couldn't stay longer (was headed to Vancouver to hike and kayak). It was the nicest hotel I've stayed at in any major city for even double that price. The room was spotless and the decor cheery and tasteful. Some folks might consider the room small but personally I dislike the yawning spaces in some hotels -- this felt like a well-appointed guest room in a private home. Beds were comfortable with silky smooth cotton sheets, vellux blankets and plump pillows. The little kichenette with microwave, fridge and sink would make it great for an extended stay and the desk was a good size with a comfortable chair. I liked the TV being atop a tall dresser -- made it easier to watch in bed. Though it was somewhat warm while I was there (low 80's during the day, 60's at night) I was happy to crank open the large windows that looked out on the interior terrace, sort of a large light shaft in the center of the building. That and the ceiling fan kept it comfortable and I much preferred it to the clammy, musty chill of the usual hotel AC units. I didn't mind at all not having an outside view because I could easily go up to the 7th floor roof deck and sit in the Adirondack chairs with a 360 degree panorama of Puget Sound, the mountains, the nearby Space Needle and all of the city center spread out beyong -- what a terrific view, day or night! Take your breakfast up there! The parking garage was very handy and reasonably priced considering the going rate at the city lots. Public transport was nearby and you could walk to some shopping and restaurants (I had dinner at an Italian bistro around the corner that was sublime). It was only a 5 minute drive to the city center and very easy access to the central parkway of Route 5. There is no kitchen in the hotel but the lobby is attached to a Starbucks and I was able to get a nice breakfast there (recommend the eggwhite, feta, spinach and sun-dried tomato wrap -- yummy!) The staff were very helpful and good-natured (and I understand they also allow pets.) I will definitely stay there again -- it was excellent for a solo traveler and I think it would be great for a cozy romantic trip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, great coffee but room ....?”
Reviews.Author: robispho
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Needle! Great!! Locatie of the Inn is excellent and parking (for an extra $ 15 a night) ok! Our stay was relaxed and staff nice. The room however could be better. The hotel has a somewhat outdated and worn atmosphere. The room was not spacious but we don't complain cons. the price. We enjoyed our stay despite the room... Rob and Inge, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “"not a better value in seattle"”
Reviews.Author: jackpine2
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a great a 4 noc stay at the Med... 5stars all the way..the staff were incredibly helpful..the housekeeping impeccable (the housekeepers routinely clean bathrrom floors on their hands and knees) and the view from the roof top truly majestic.. and the location is very convenient.Granted the hotel doesn't have a kitchen (I recommed the metropoltian supermarket 3 blocks away for a great breakfast and the plunket- 1/2 block away for good thai food) ..suggest book early hotel staff will match discounted rates and ask for top floor with harbor view if available..a must for another stay in seattle

Reviews.Title: “Chain-like hotel, but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: lisa_teany
Reviews.Content: It looks like a chain, feels like a chain... but it isn't! The Mediterranean Inn was a perfectly fine place to stay in Seattle. Great location, being a very short walk to Seattle Center, and a mile or so to Belltown and downtown. We got a pretty decent deal on Hotels.com, a little over $100 a night. Didn't really care about the Starbucks in the lobby, although it made the lobby smell nice. Down the street from Peso's, which serves an amazing breakfast. The staff we dealt with were very friendly, and the roof deck was awesome -- made up for the lackluster third-floor view.

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive, well located hotel, well suited for those who won't be in their rooms for too long.”
Reviews.Author: Teguzco
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Mediterranean Inn online, at a very competitive rate for the area. It's clean, reasonably well maintained and the beds were extremely comfortable, though only full, not queens. The hotel was more than willing to take our bags and issue a parking card when we arrived well before the 4:00 p.m. check-in time. Only blocks from Seattle Center, it's in walking distance to the monorail and close to many ethnic restaurants. (We tried Mexican and Indian.) The view from the rooftop is fairly impressive on a clear day and after sunset. The room did not have a view and the sound from the open window might not sit well with those not used to sleeping surrounded by the sounds of the city. We had no problem with it over our two nights, after spending hours sight seeing. Our room was better suited for two than three people, if we had planned to spend much time in our room. On-site parking at $15 a day may seem steep at first, until you walk the neighborhood and discover rates at lots of $5 and hour and more, due to the proximity to Seattle Center. The $5 a day charge for an ethernet connection is a bit disappointing. I'll have no problem recommending it to my friends who like a good price and a comfortable hotel with ready access to the sights of downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location: NO Air Conditioning. Rooms Can be Very Hot”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Fun40123
Reviews.Content: Nice location. It is important to know that there is no air conditioning in most of the rooms. That is probably fine most of the year. Can make it very unpleasant in August when the room is eighty degrees at night. You can open the window and run the fan, but the noise from street traffic makes for a noisy night.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in great Seattle Center/Queen Anne location”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: I recommend my visitors stay in this hotel when they visit me in Seattle because it is cheap and in a great location near the Space Needle and waterfront. It is definitely basic/no frills, so if you're looking for something really nice, I wouldn't recommend it. But if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room this place is perfect. The rooms and bathroom are very large and very clean, but the beds are a little hard and the bedspreads are thin and nothing special. The common areas are nice and clean and the receptionists always friendly and helpful. The great thing about this place is that it is literally in the shadow of the Space Needle and a few blocks from the Olympic Sculpture Park. It is about a mile from downtown shopping and Pike's Place Market. It is located in Queen Anne, which is a very cute neighborhood area just north of downtown. I would highly recommend Peso's Mexican Kitchen for a late night drink or dinner, and they have amazing breakfast (best in town). You should also visit the top of Queen Anne and browse the shops there.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: raisinette
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location and had one of the best prices in town. I did however, stay the same time as the person below and had to tolerate the very rare 103 degree Seattle weather in a non-air conditioned room. It wasn't totally unbearable, but definitely hot. All rooms are simply decorated with no frills. The roof-top lookout was a fun place to watch the sunset and we were lucky enough to catch the Blue Angels rehearsing for Seafair:) This is a great place to stay of you do not have a car. It is located just blocks from Seattle Center (Space Needle) and the monorail and has an array of restaurants to choose from near by. There is a Business Center in the lobby for internet access and the hotel is connected to a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freoshocker
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The location is a five minute walk from Seattle Centre where the monorail begins its trip to the city centre. The rooms were spacious and meticulously clean, the staff were very helpful. This hotel is value for money. There are numerous bars and restaurants that would suit most people in the immediate area, so finding somewhere to eat or drink was not difficult.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AKskater
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recommendation from Alpine Ascents Int'l. They were very accommodating for my stay before and after my climb of Mt Rainier. The staff was so nice, I thought it was strange they were that nice and helpful (I live in the D.C. area- you don't get helpful service like that here). The rooftop deck had great views of the space needle and puget sound. I thought the location was great - good neighborhood restaurants and cafes, as well as a couple of grocery stores. The area was much more relaxed than staying in the downtown area.
